Fix a couple leaks regarding keyrings. pgp_keyring_free only frees the allocated data inside the keyring. The keyring structure itself should also be freed. We may have to revisit why rnp_generate_key frees the keyrings at some point.
Fix a memory leak with pgp_seckey_free. A seckey also contains a pubkey, which has BNs that must be freed.
rnp_tests: Fix a couple of memory leaks.
Fix memory leak in rnp_end. pgp_keyring_free only frees the internal keys member of the structure. The structure itself is allocated with calloc and must be freed here.
Remove a debugging printf.
Fix rnp_set_homedir always failing. The logic wasn\'t right here so it would always return 0 in the else block.
Undo commit \'Remove (hopefully) legacy code from signature check\'. Apparently this was checking the PKCS encoding leading bytes and I was covering up a bug by removing this.
Fix reliance on uninitialized out_length for RSA signing. This parameter is used as both input and output. If it were set to 0, for example, the botan signing call would correctly fail.
Fix RSA signatures.
Fix DSA signature verification.
Fix typo colon=>semicolon
Commented out the failing test until the issues are fixed.
Fixed `/home/max` dependency.

fixed compilation error.

1. Added negative test case for homedir option. 2. Fixed the bug where certain user defined parameters were not used by the application; NOTE: this has an impact on the initialization of the RP. Needs careful consideration before merging changes.
-Fixed bug which lead to stalling of the build. -General clean-up
ci: fix PR tests (#2) Since we\'re using \'set -u\' for this script, we have to give COVERITY_SCAN_BRANCH a default value if unset before the comparison.

The amount of hardcoded places where .gnupg appears is much larger than I thought but it has been changed for rnp and rnpkeys. Fixed a couple of immediate bugs regarding key paths and discovered more - key path handling is inconsistent throughout the application and needs a lot more work.
This is a fairly big change and there may be bugs. Among many miscellaneous style changes and casual refactoring changes have been applied re: #43.
